title: 507 people killed in 526 accidents across Bangladesh in Nov: report
body: At least 507 people were killed and 899 others were injured in 526 road accidents across Bangladesh in November this year, according to a report of the Passenger Welfare Association of Bangladesh. Motorcycle accidents caused significant numbers of deaths, said the report released on Monday. It said that 201 people (41.1 per cent of the deaths) were killed and 171 people (20.82 per cent of the injured) were injured in 195 road accidents (38.69 per cent of the accidents) involving motorcycles. In 44 railway accidents, 40 people were killed and one was injured. In seven waterways accidents, six people were killed and four remained missing. The association issued a press release with a summary of its monthly report, which was based on tallying the incidents reported by the media. Regarding the occupations of those who died, 127 were transport workers, including drivers, 93 were pedestrians, 43 students,12 teachers, six political leaders and activists, six were members of differently law enforcement agencies and five were physicians.
